page.title: 01Around Holbeach Bank.
page.content: The three villages in our block are Holbeach Bank,Saracen's Head and Moulton Seas End.The landscape around here is very flat and fertile and is intensively farmed. The nearest town, Holbeach, is two miles away but there is a village shop and post office in Saracen's Head and Moulton Seas End. The roads are often tracks leading to farms and allotments.The farmers around here have mostly vegetable crops. Some fields have cows and sheep in.The present Sea Bank round the wash is about 10 km from our block.The name Moulton Seas End shows that the sea used to come much further inland.The village of Holbeach Bank which was built along the original sea bank before the Domesday Book was compiled in 1086.The block was marshland then.
